required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ovarian Reserve in Patients With Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: Ovarian Reserve in Patients With Psoriasis

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Psoriasis is a common autoimmune disease. It affects women of all ages including reproductive years. Autoimmune diseases including psoriasis are linked to premature ovarian reserve. This study aims to measure serum hormones including FSH,LH,E2,PRL and AMH (indicators of ovarian reserve) in women with and without psoriasis.

detailed_description.textblock: Psoriasis is a common autoimmune disease. It affects women of all ages including reproductive years. Almost 75% of patients are diagnosed before the age of 40. There is also increased evidence on autoimmune disease and their link to premature ovarian failure.Ovarian reserve is important for the reproductive period. The measurements of serum hormones including follicle stimulating hormone (FSH),luteinizing hormone (LH),prolactin (PRL), estradiol (E2) and anti-mullerian hormone (AMH) will give us an idea about the ovarian reserve. The investigators aim is to measure ovarian reserve parameters in patients newly diagnosed with psoriasis and to compare them to healthy controls. Serum FSH,LH,E2,PRL and AMH will be measured on the 3rd day of the cycle.The serum hormone levels will be compared between women with psoriasis and women without psoriasis

primary_outcome.measure: to compare serum AMH levels between the two groups
primary_outcome.description: Serum AMH levels will be measured (using ELISA) and compared between the two groups

arm_group.description: Reproductive age women newly diagnosed with psoriasis
Reproductive age women without psoriasis to serve as control

intervention.description: Blood sampling on the 3rd day of menstrual cycle for the measurement of serum FSH,LH,PRL,E2 and AMH hormone levels.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood withdrawals for the measurement of serum FSH,LH,E2,PRL and AMH

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be reproductive age women with newly diagnosed psoriasis. The control population will be aged match women without psoriasis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Reproductive age group women: 18-40 years
- Women newly diagnosed with psoriasis (case group)
- Women without psoriasis (control group)
Exclusion Criteria:
- women with PCOS (polycystic ovary syndrome)
- women with history or present endometriosis
- history of ovarian surgery
- Body mass index (BMI) over 30
- smokers
- Women with other autoimmune diseases including Hashitomo thyroiditis
- Women with family history of premature ovarian insufficiency (POI)
- Women with infertility

overall_official.affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Research and Training Hospital

link.description: premature ovarian failure in patients with psoriasis

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
